and when farmers start this this whole process of growing food they start at
the beginning of their season and plan their whole year around yield and what they're expecting to get yield
is the most important single most important thing when they're planning out
what different levers they have to pull in this process of growing food whether it's irrigating applying
fertilizer management getting labor and equipment together so
what we do is we provide yield forecasts in a context to the yield forecast at the beginning of the season so they
can begin to map out and plan for what they're doing every step of the way
um so they have an accurate idea of the resources that they're putting in and they're not wasting anything
basically we're helping them optimize this process um yield forecasting is something that's
not new it's been done it actually happens with a person you know before bountiful came around people
would go out into the field with a visual inspection and in the case of grapes they would go
out to the vineyards and count clusters and count how many fruit how many grapes
are on the cluster weigh some of the fruit and extrapolate that out but with that result it's a lot of labor
and it's actually has high error rate so in grapes you can get as high error rate with that
method from 30 to 40 percent with almonds it's 20 to 40 percent based
off of the variety in the location and we've helped to solve that and bring that down and improve it
two to four times so our accuracy is 90 or better and we do this through all the data that
we collect in machine learning and so it really helps them plan out their season and optimize
because you want to put the right amount of water and the right amount of inputs for what you can expect at harvest
